intro: Cheiridopsis glabra, commonly known as the nakedleaf ice plant, is a succulent species native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its characteristic adaptations to arid environments. The plant has fleshy, blue-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white wax, which helps reduce water loss. It produces small, yellow flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. Cheiridopsis glabra is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
